00025 /**
00026  * Multi-process usage support for ApplicationPool.
00027  *
00028  * ApplicationPoolServer implements a client/server architecture for ApplicationPool.
00029  * This allows one to use ApplicationPool in a multi-process environment (unlike
00030  * StandardApplicationPool). The cache/pool data is stored in the server. Different
00031  * processes can then access the pool through the server.
00032  *
00033  * ApplicationPoolServer itself does not inherit ApplicationPool. Instead, it returns
00034  * an ApplicationPool object via the connect() call. For example:
00035  * @code
00036  *   // Create an ApplicationPoolServer.
00037  *   ApplicationPoolServer server(...);
00038  *   
00039  *   // Now fork a child process, like Apache's prefork MPM eventually will.
00040  *   pid_t pid = fork();
00041  *   if (pid == 0) {
00042  *       // Child process
00043  *       
00044  *       // Connect to the server. After connection, we have an ApplicationPool
00045  *       // object!
00046  *       ApplicationPoolPtr pool(server.connect());
00047  *
00048  *       // The child process doesn't run a server (only the parent process does)
00049  *       // so we call detach to free the server resources (things like file
00050  *       // descriptors).
00051  *       server.detach();
00052  *
00053  *       ApplicationPool::SessionPtr session(pool->get("/home/webapps/foo"));
00054  *       do_something_with(session);
00055  *
00056  *       _exit(0);
00057  *   } else {
00058  *       // Parent process
00059  *       waitpid(pid, NULL, 0);
00060  *   }
00061  * @endcode
00062  *
00063  * @warning
00064  *   ApplicationPoolServer uses threads internally. Threads will disappear after a fork(),
00065  *   so ApplicationPoolServer will become usable as a server after a fork(). After a fork(),
00066  *   you can still call connect() (and, of course, detach()), but the same
00067  *   ApplicationPoolServer better still be running in the parent process. So in case of
00068  *   Apache with the prefork MPM, be sure to create an ApplicationPoolServer
00069  *   <em>after</em> Apache has daemonized.
00070  *
00071  * <h2>Implementation notes</h2>
00072  * Notice that ApplicationPoolServer does do not use TCP sockets at all, or even named Unix
00073  * sockets, depite being a server that can handle multiple clients! So ApplicationPoolServer
00074  * will expose no open ports or temporary Unix socket files. Only child processes are able
00075  * to use the ApplicationPoolServer.
00076  *
00077  * This is implemented through anonymous Unix sockets (<tt>socketpair()</tt>) and file descriptor
00078  * passing. It allows one to emulate <tt>accept()</tt>. During initialization,
00079  * ApplicationPoolServer creates a pair of Unix sockets, one called <tt>serverSocket</tt>
00080  * and the other called <tt>connectSocket</tt>. There is a thread which continuously
00081  * listens on serverSocket for incoming data. The data itself is not important, because it
00082  * only serves to wake up the thread. ApplicationPoolServer::connect() sends some data through
00083  * connectSocket, which wakes up the server thread. The server thread will then create
00084  * a pair of Unix sockets. One of them is passed through serverSocket. The other will be
00085  * handled by a newly created client thread. So the socket that was passed through serverSocket
00086  * is the client's connection to the server, while the other socket is the server's connection
00087  * to the client.
00088  *
00089  * Note that serverSocket and connectSocket are solely used for setting up new connections
00090  * ala accept(). They are not used for any actual data. In fact, they cannot be used in any
00091  * other way without some sort of inter-process synchronization mechanism, because all
00092  * child processes are connected to the same serverSocket. In contrast,
00093  * ApplicationPoolServer::connect() allows one to setup a private communicate channel between
00094  * the server and the current child process.
00095  *
00096  * Also note that each client is handled by a seperate thread. This is necessary because
00097  * ApplicationPoolServer internally uses StandardApplicationPool, and the current algorithm
00098  * for StandardApplicationPool::get() can block (in the case that the spawning limit has
00099  * been exceeded). While it is possible to get around this problem without using threads,
00100  * a thread-based implementation is easier to write.
00101  *
00102  * @ingroup Support
00103  */
00104 class ApplicationPoolServer {

00107          * Contains data shared between RemoteSession and Client.
00108          * Since RemoteSession and Client have different life times, i.e. one may be
00109          * destroyed before the other, they both use a smart pointer that points to
00110          * a SharedData. This way, the SharedData object is only destroyed when
00111          * both the RemoteSession and the Client object has been destroyed.
00112          */

00115                  * The socket connection to the server, as was established by
00116                  * ApplicationPoolServer::connect().
00117                  */

00119                 
00120                 ~SharedData() {

00122                 }
00123         };

00274                 ~ClientInfo() {
00275                         close(fd);
00276                         // For some reason, joining or deleting (detaching)
00277                         // the thread after fork() will cause a segfault.
00278                         // I haven't figured out why that happens, so for now
00279                         // I'll just ignore the thread (which isn't running
00280                         // anyway).
00281                         if (!detached) {
00282                                 delete thr;
00283                         }
00284                 }

00300         /**
00301          * The entry point of the server thread which sets up private connections.
00302          * See the class overview's implementation notes for details.
00303          */
00304         void serverThreadMainLoop() {
00305                 while (!done) {
00306                         int fds[2], ret;
00307                         char x;
00308                         
00309                         // The received data only serves to wake up the server socket,
00310                         // and is not important.
00311                         do {
00312                                 ret = read(serverSocket, &x, 1);
00313                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00314                         if (ret == 0) {
00315                                 break;
00316                         }
00317                         
00318                         // Incoming connect request.
00319                         do {
00320                                 ret = socketpair(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0, fds);
00321                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00322                         if (ret == -1) {
00323                                 int e = errno;
00324                                 P_ERROR("Cannot create an anonymous Unix socket: " <<
00325                                         strerror(e) << " (" << e << ") --- aborting!");
00326                                 abort();
00327                                 
00328                                 // Shut up compiler warning.
00329                                 bool x = false;
00330                                 if (x) {
00331                                         printf("%d", e);
00332                                 }
00333                         }
00334                         
00335                         try {
00336                                 MessageChannel(serverSocket).writeFileDescriptor(fds[1]);
00337                                 do {
00338                                         ret = close(fds[1]);
00339                                 } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00340                         } catch (SystemException &e) {
00341                                 P_ERROR("Cannot send a file descriptor: " << e.brief() <<
00342                                         " --- aborting!");
00343                                 abort();
00344                         } catch (const exception &e) {
00345                                 P_ERROR("Cannot send a file descriptor: " << e.what() <<
00346                                         " --- aborting!");
00347                                 abort();
00348                         }
00349                         
00350                         ClientInfoPtr info(new ClientInfo());
00351                         info->fd = fds[0];
00352                         info->thr = new thread(bind(&ApplicationPoolServer::clientThreadMainLoop, this, info));
00353                         mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00354                         clients.insert(info);
00355                 }
00356         }

00358         /**
00359          * The entry point of a thread which handles exactly one client.
00360          */
00361         void clientThreadMainLoop(ClientInfoPtr client) {
00362                 MessageChannel channel(client->fd);
00363                 vector<string> args;
00364                 map<int, Application::SessionPtr> sessions;
00365                 int lastID = 0;
00366 
00367                 try {
00368                         while (!done) {
00369                                 if (!channel.read(args)) {
00370                                         break;
00371                                 }
00372                         
00373                                 if (args[0] == "get" && args.size() == 4) {
00374                                         Application::SessionPtr session;
00375                                         bool failed = false;
00376                                         try {
00377                                                 session = pool.get(args[1], args[2] == "true", args[3]);
00378                                         } catch (const SpawnException &e) {
00379                                                 channel.write("SpawnException", e.what(), NULL);
00380                                                 failed = true;
00381                                         } catch (const IOException &e) {
00382                                                 channel.write("IOException", e.what(), NULL);
00383                                                 failed = true;
00384                                         }
00385                                         if (!failed) {
00386                                                 channel.write("ok", toString(session->getPid()).c_str(),
00387                                                         toString(lastID).c_str(), NULL);
00388                                                 channel.writeFileDescriptor(session->getReader());
00389                                                 channel.writeFileDescriptor(session->getWriter());
00390                                                 session->closeReader();
00391                                                 session->closeWriter();
00392                                                 sessions[lastID] = session;
00393                                                 lastID++;
00394                                         }
00395                                 
00396                                 } else if (args[0] == "close" && args.size() == 2) {
00397                                         sessions.erase(atoi(args[1]));
00398                                 
00399                                 } else if (args[0] == "setMax" && args.size() == 2) {
00400                                         pool.setMax(atoi(args[1]));
00401                                 
00402                                 } else if (args[0] == "getActive" && args.size() == 1) {
00403                                         channel.write(toString(pool.getActive()).c_str(), NULL);
00404                                 
00405                                 } else if (args[0] == "getCount" && args.size() == 1) {
00406                                         channel.write(toString(pool.getCount()).c_str(), NULL);
00407                                 
00408                                 } else if (args[0] == "getSpawnServerPid" && args.size() == 1) {
00409                                         channel.write(toString(pool.getSpawnServerPid()).c_str(), NULL);
00410                                 
00411                                 } else {
00412                                         string name;
00413                                         if (args.empty()) {
00414                                                 name = "(null)";
00415                                         } else {
00416                                                 name = args[0];
00417                                         }
00418                                         P_WARN("An ApplicationPoolServer client sent an invalid command: "
00419                                                 << name << " (" << args.size() << " elements)");
00420                                         done = true;
00421                                 }
00422                         }
00423                 } catch (const exception &e) {
00424                         P_WARN("Uncaught exception in ApplicationPoolServer client thread: " <<
00425                                 e.what());
00426                 }
00427                 
00428                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00429                 clients.erase(client);
00430         }

00434          * Create a new ApplicationPoolServer object.
00435          *
00436          * @param spawnServerCommand The filename of the spawn server to use.
00437          * @param logFile Specify a log file that the spawn server should use.
00438          *            Messages on its standard output and standard error channels
00439          *            will be written to this log file. If an empty string is
00440          *            specified, no log file will be used, and the spawn server
00441          *            will use the same standard output/error channels as the
00442          *            current process.
00443          * @param environment The RAILS_ENV environment that all RoR applications
00444          *            should use. If an empty string is specified, the current value
00445          *            of the RAILS_ENV environment variable will be used.
00446          * @param rubyCommand The Ruby interpreter's command.
00447          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server
00448          *            or the server socket.
00449          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.
00450          */
00451         ApplicationPoolServer(const string &spawnServerCommand,
00452                      const string &logFile = "",
00453                      const string &environment = "production",
00454                      const string &rubyCommand = "ruby")
00455         : pool(spawnServerCommand, logFile, environment, rubyCommand) {
00456                 int fds[2];
00457                 
00458                 if (socketpair(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0, fds) == -1) {
00459                         throw SystemException("Cannot create a Unix socket pair", errno);
00460                 }
00461                 serverSocket = fds[0];
00462                 connectSocket = fds[1];
00463                 done = false;
00464                 detached = false;
00465                 serverThread = new thread(bind(&ApplicationPoolServer::serverThreadMainLoop, this));
00466         }
00467         
00468         ~ApplicationPoolServer() {
00469                 if (!detached) {
00470                         done = true;
00471                         close(connectSocket);
00472                         serverThread->join();
00473                         delete serverThread;
00474                         close(serverSocket);
00475                         
00476                         set<ClientInfoPtr> clientsCopy;
00477                         {
00478                                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00479                                 clientsCopy = clients;
00480                         }
00481                         set<ClientInfoPtr>::iterator it;
00482                         for (it = clientsCopy.begin(); it != clientsCopy.end(); it++) {
00483                                 (*it)->thr->join();
00484                         }
00485                 }
00486         }

00488         /**
00489          * Connects to the server and returns a usable ApplicationPool object.
00490          * All cache/pool data of this ApplicationPool is actually stored on the server
00491          * and shared with other clients, but that is totally transparent.
00492          *
00493          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00494          * @throws IOException Something went wrong.
00495          */
00496         ApplicationPoolPtr connect() {
00497                 MessageChannel channel(connectSocket);
00498                 int fd;
00499                 
00500                 // Write some random data to wake up the server.
00501                 channel.writeRaw("x", 1);
00502                 
00503                 fd = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00504                 return ptr(new Client(fd));
00505         }
00506         
00507         /**
00508          * Detach the server by freeing up some server resources such as file descriptors.
00509          * This should be called by child processes that wish to use a server, but do
00510          * not run the server itself.
00511          *
00512          * This method may only be called once. The ApplicationPoolServer object
00513          * will become unusable once detach() has been called.
00514          *
00515          * @warning Never call this method in the process in which this
00516          *    ApplicationPoolServer was created!
00517          */
00518         void detach() {
00519                 detached = true;
00520                 close(connectSocket);
00521                 close(serverSocket);
00522                 serverThread->join();
00523                 delete serverThread;
00524                 
00525                 // A client thread might have a reference to a ClientInfo
00526                 // object. And because that thread doesn't run anymore after a
00527                 // fork(), the reference never gets removed and the ClientInfo
00528                 // object never gets destroyed. So we forcefully delete
00529                 // ClientInfo objects in order to close the client file
00530                 // descriptors.
00531                 set<ClientInfoPtr>::iterator it;
00532                 for (it = clients.begin(); it != clients.end(); it++) {
00533                         if (!it->unique()) {
00534                                 (*it)->detach();
00535                                 delete it->get();
00536                         }
00537                 }
00538                 clients.clear();
00539                 
00540                 pool.detach();
00541         }
